The Illinois Constitution requires Gov: Bruce Rauner to draw up a balanced budget plan each year, but experts agree that he did not do so in 2015, 2016, or the previous year.
Rauner: s claim of introducing balanced budgets every year was met with sarcastic laughter from Democrats during his State of the State speech.
Critics: including the executive director of the Center for Tax and Budget Accountability, argue that Rauner has never introduced a balanced budget and that his previous claim of doing so was not an isolated incident.
